page.title: 17Bashley.
page.content: Laoder's Garage, Bashley, is owned and run by Mr John Loader. The business was started by his father, his grandfather was for many years the village blacksmith. Five people work at the garage including Mr Loader and one of his sons. Mrs Loader helps whenever she can. The garage sells Shell petrol. Servicing, repairs and M.O.T.'s are carried out on vehicles belonging mainly to local people. During the summer a lot of tourists pass through the area and this brings in some extra trade. Mr and Mrs Loader live in the village with their five children in a three bedroomed house. The house has gas fired central heating and a log burning stove. Mrs Loader takes the two youngest children to school each day in New Milton. Mr and Mrs Loader are founder members of the Bashley '6'.
